intro: Galium maritimum f. luteum, commonly known as the yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features slender, branched stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from white to yellow, depending on the variety. The yellow bedstraw is adapted to saline soils and is often found in dunes and coastal scrub habitats.
